page.title: 20Rothschilds And Wendover
page.content: Victorian millionaire banker Alfred de Rothschild created a continental chateau at nearby Halton, bringing Royalty and extravagance. In 1914, Alfred lent his parkland to Kitchener's army who mustered and trained before facing the mud of Flanders. The RFC took over and on his death in 1918 Alfred's estate which had seen a staff of hundreds, performances by Melba, agricultural shows, circuses, hunting parties and champagne picnics became RAF Halton, his chateau the officers' Mess. The uildings, hostelries and life in 1985 Wendover still reflect Rothschild' philanthropy and the effects of providing "out of camp" needs of countless soldiers and airmen. Words, impressions and photographs by pupils, staff and parents of Wendover Middle School.
